Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Lactocin 63 (natural AMPs; bacteriocin;  UCLL1c; Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes; XXA)

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (45.45%) toOligoventinQ=R: 18%. Mol formula: C66H101N20O18S1, Mol Wt: 1493.712; Mol Ex Coeff: 7040; GRAVY: -1.66.Purification: Purified from supernatant of the bacterial culture.Activity: active against both Gram+ and Gram- bacteria e.g., S. putrefaciens (MIC, to be updated).The original entry Microbisporicin A2 has been merged with AP01617 (Microbisporicin A2) due to similar activity and sequence. 2/2023; 9/2024.
Literature Information.Author: Han J, Meng X, Shen H, Luo W, Yao S, Yang J, Zhu Q, Tian Y, Wang S. 2021
Literature Information.Title: Purification, molecular characterization of Lactocin 63 produced by Lactobacillus coryniformis FZU63 and its antimicrobial mode of action against Shewanella putrefaciens.
